DOC.brief_summary: The objective study compare effectiveness high intensity interval training ( HIT ) traditional aerobic training person stroke .
DOC.brief_title: High Intensity Interval Training Chronic Stroke
DOC.detailed_description: Participants randomize either HIT traditional aerobic training ; 25 minute , 3 time per week 4 week . Outcomes measure training blind rater .
DOC.criteria: 1 ) age 3590 year 2 ) unilateral stroke experience > 6 month prior enrollment 3 ) able walk 10m overground assistive device need physical assistance 4 ) able walk 3 minute treadmill > .13m/s ( 0.3mph ) aerobic exercise contraindication 5 ) stable cardiovascular condition ( American Heart Association class B , allow aerobic capacity < 6 metabolic equivalent ) 6 ) discharge formal rehabilitation 1 ) significant rest ECG abnormality 2 ) evidence significant arrhythmia myocardial ischemia treadmill ECG stress test 3 ) hospitalization cardiac pulmonary disease within 3 month 4 ) pacemaker implant defibrillator 5 ) low extremity claudication 6 ) unable communicate investigator correctly answer consent comprehension question 7 ) severe low extremity spasticity ( Ashworth > 2 ) 8 ) low extremity weight bear pain > 4/10 visual analogue scale For transcranial magnetic stimulation substudy , additional exclusion also apply . These include large cerebral infarct structural defect potential increase seizure risk , uncontrolled seizure , metal implant previous craniotomy .
